author: JN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2017
review_content: The good news is that mine works, in contrast to some very critical reviews. I do have issues and probably would not have bought this one if I had known. Not a true deal killer, but the "XL - King Size" is a joke.It is less than 1/20th of the size of a King Size mattress, about the size of my pillow case. Like a (flat) pillow, it fits under two feet or two legs or across the small of the back. That said, the temp works. I find #2 is comfy all night long and #3 too warm all night long. The "wet" property is good if you go too high and sweat. And the cover is very soft one one side. Since the pad does warm up fast, it is great to put on a pillow or bed spot to heat up a spot before getting in bed or chair.The issues I have relate to the control and cord. The control buttons are too easy to touch and turn on or off features way too easily in the middle of the night. The distance between the pad and control is very short, so the control can get up into bed and/or be very difficult to reach. When the pad is under my neck, the control can be under me if I roll over the wrong way. So I will probably cut the wire and splice in an extra 3-5 feet of wire between the pad and control (safely using an electrician's splice). As others have noted, the kludge connector from the wire to pad is bulky and uncomfortable when you lie on it. The short overall cord length requires an extension cord to reach the outlet. At this price, a longer cord seems better than people using a cheap extension cord that might be under capacity of the this small pad.
title: It works, Pillow size, NOT King, & some Control design issues.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: This is a great heating pad for pain relief. The heat that it puts out is more than adequate. My only complaints with this thing are these. The second issue is the controller. The way it's oriented feels wrong. You expect the bottom to have more pull to it when you hold it, but it's the top that pulls. I know that probably doesn't make sense, but if you purchase this you will understand what I mean. The closest thing I can relate it to is this. Plug your cell phone into it's charging cable. Chances are the cable goes into the bottom of your phone and it feels right when you hold it while it's plugged in. Now keep it plugged in, but rotate it 180 degrees so that the cable is now at the TOP of your hand. That's what I mean. It doesn't feel right. But once you get past those two things it boils down to that this is a great heating pad. Definitely worth a shot.

review_content: I ordered this heating pad back in February...LOVED IT!  It was everything I wanted... then it died a smidge less than 9 months later. That one arrives... and within a few days, stops working... so I return out and order another one... that one arrives and right out of the box won't get above 90 degrees, even on the highest setting.
